description: Verify that the System Logs page loads correctly with admin authentication
scenario: Admin user navigates to the System Logs page to view and monitor system activity
expected_results: Display the complete System Logs page with header, filter controls, log type selection, and data table with pagination
procedure:
1. Login as admin user with valid credentials
2. Navigate to /admin/logs
3. Verify page loads completely
4. Check that header shows 'Logs' title with file icon
5. Verify all main sections are visible (header, filters, table, pagination)

description: Verify that non-admin users cannot access the System Logs page
scenario: Regular user attempts to access the System Logs page without admin privileges
expected_results: User should be redirected to login page or receive access denied message
procedure:
1. Login as regular user (non-admin)
2. Attempt to navigate to /admin/logs
3. Verify access is denied
4. Check redirect behavior
5. Confirm proper error handling

description: Verify that the log type filter dropdown works correctly for switching between different log categories
scenario: Admin uses the log type filter to view different types of system logs
expected_results: Filter dropdown allows selection of Login Attempts, User Registrations, Email Verifications, and Contact Submissions with proper data updates
procedure:
1. Access System Logs page as admin
2. Verify default selection is 'Login Attempts'
3. Change filter to 'User Registrations'
4. Verify table updates with user registration data
5. Test all filter options and confirm data changes appropriately

description: Verify that login attempts logs display correctly with proper formatting and status indicators
scenario: Admin reviews login attempts to monitor system security and access patterns
expected_results: Display login attempts with username/email, IP address, success/failure status badges, and timestamps
procedure:
1. Navigate to Login Attempts log type
2. Verify table headers: Username/Email, IP Address, Status, Date
3. Check success/failure status badges with appropriate colors (green/red)
4. Verify IP addresses and timestamps are formatted correctly
5. Confirm responsive behavior on mobile (IP address hidden)

description: Verify that user registration logs display correctly with user information and status badges
scenario: Admin reviews user registration history to monitor account creation patterns
expected_results: Display user registrations with avatars, usernames, emails, status badges (Active/Inactive, Admin), and registration timestamps
procedure:
1. Change log type to 'User Registrations'
2. Verify table headers: User, Email, Status, Date
3. Check user avatars display with correct initials
4. Verify status badges show proper colors and text
5. Confirm email column is hidden on mobile

description: Verify that email verification logs display correctly with verification status and user information
scenario: Admin reviews email verification activity to monitor account verification processes
expected_results: Display email verifications with email addresses, usernames, status badges (Verified/Pending/Expired), and timestamps
procedure:
1. Change log type to 'Email Verifications'
2. Verify table headers: Email, User, Status, Date
3. Check status badges display correct colors (green/yellow/red)
4. Verify user column shows username or 'Unknown'
5. Confirm date formatting is consistent

description: Verify that contact form submission logs display correctly with contact information and subject truncation
scenario: Admin reviews contact form submissions to monitor user inquiries and feedback
expected_results: Display contact submissions with name, email, subject (truncated), and submission timestamps
procedure:
1. Change log type to 'Contact Submissions'
2. Verify table headers: Contact, Subject, Date
3. Check contact information displays name and email
4. Verify subject truncation to 30 characters on mobile, 50 on desktop
5. Confirm subject column is hidden on mobile

description: Verify that the export logs feature generates correct CSV files for each log type
scenario: Admin exports different types of logs to CSV format for external analysis
expected_results: Export button generates downloadable CSV files with appropriate headers and data for each log type
procedure:
1. Select 'Login Attempts' and click Export Logs
2. Verify CSV file downloads with correct filename and headers
3. Test export for each log type
4. Check CSV content format and data accuracy
5. Verify file download behavior in browser

description: Verify that pagination controls function correctly for large log datasets
scenario: Admin navigates through multiple pages of log data using pagination controls
expected_results: Pagination shows correct page numbers, Previous/Next buttons work, per-page options function correctly
procedure:
1. Locate pagination controls at top and bottom of table
2. Test Previous/Next navigation buttons
3. Change per-page display options (25, 50, 100)
4. Verify page numbers update correctly
5. Check result count displays accurate information

description: Verify that appropriate empty state messages display when no log data is available
scenario: Admin views log types that have no data or filters that return no results
expected_results: Display appropriate empty state message with helpful icon and descriptive text
procedure:
1. View log type with no data (Email Verifications)
2. Verify empty state message displays
3. Check icon and messaging are appropriate
4. Verify styling matches design system
5. Test empty state for all log types when applicable

description: Verify that the System Logs page displays correctly on different screen sizes
scenario: Admin accesses the logs page on various devices and screen resolutions
expected_results: Page layout adapts appropriately with responsive table design, hidden columns on mobile, and proper text sizing
procedure:
1. Access page on desktop (1920x1080)
2. Resize browser window to tablet size (768px)
3. Test on mobile viewport (375px)
4. Verify table columns hide appropriately on smaller screens
5. Check that all content remains accessible and readable

description: Verify that the System Logs page displays correctly in dark mode
scenario: Admin toggles dark mode and verifies all components display with appropriate dark theme styling
expected_results: All sections, table, filters, and status badges display with proper dark mode colors and contrast
procedure:
1. Access page in light mode
2. Toggle to dark mode
3. Verify background colors change to dark variants
4. Check text contrast and readability
5. Confirm all status badges maintain proper visibility

description: Verify proper error handling when invalid log types are specified
scenario: Admin attempts to access logs with invalid log type parameters
expected_results: Display appropriate error message and redirect to default log view
procedure:
1. Navigate to /admin/logs?type=invalid_type
2. Verify 'Invalid log type' error message displays
3. Check redirect to default logs page
4. Test with various invalid parameters
5. Confirm proper error handling in all cases

description: Verify that all date and time displays use consistent formatting throughout the logs interface
scenario: Admin reviews various date fields to ensure consistent formatting and timezone handling
expected_results: Timestamps display in consistent format with desktop showing full dates (MM/DD/YYYY HH:MM:SS) and mobile showing abbreviated (MM/DD HH:MM)
procedure:
1. Review timestamps in login attempts logs
2. Check user registration date formatting
3. Verify email verification date consistency
4. Confirm contact submission timestamps
5. Test responsive date format changes on mobile

description: Verify that the 'Back to Dashboard' navigation button functions correctly
scenario: Admin uses the back navigation to return to the admin dashboard
expected_results: Clicking 'Back to Dashboard' navigates to /admin with proper context preservation
procedure:
1. Navigate to logs from admin dashboard
2. Click 'Back to Dashboard' button in header
3. Verify navigation to admin dashboard
4. Check that previous dashboard state is maintained
5. Confirm button styling and hover effects work

description: Verify that status badges use consistent color coding throughout all log types
scenario: Admin reviews status badges across different log types to ensure proper color coding and accessibility
expected_results: Consistent color scheme: green for success/active/verified, red for failed/inactive/expired, yellow for pending, purple for admin
procedure:
1. Check login attempt status colors (green/red)
2. Verify user status badges (green/red for active/inactive, purple for admin)
3. Review email verification status colors (green/yellow/red)
4. Confirm color contrast meets accessibility standards
5. Test color consistency across all log types

description: Verify that table rows display appropriate hover effects for better user interaction
scenario: Admin hovers over log table rows to test visual feedback and interaction states
expected_results: Table rows highlight on hover with smooth transition effects and clear visual feedback
procedure:
1. Hover over various table rows
2. Verify background color changes on hover
3. Check transition smoothness
4. Test hover effects in both light and dark mode
5. Confirm hover states don't interfere with text readability

description: Verify that per-page parameter validation prevents abuse and maintains valid values
scenario: Admin attempts to manipulate per-page parameters to test input validation
expected_results: Per-page values are restricted to valid options (25, 50, 100) with default fallback for invalid values
procedure:
1. Test valid per-page values (25, 50, 100)
2. Attempt invalid per-page value via URL manipulation
3. Verify system defaults to 25 for invalid values
4. Check dropdown only shows valid options
5. Confirm URL parameters are properly validated

description: Verify that the logs system handles database errors gracefully
scenario: Admin accesses logs when database connectivity issues occur
expected_results: Appropriate error messages display when database is unavailable, with graceful fallback behavior
procedure:
1. Simulate database unavailability
2. Access logs page
3. Verify appropriate error message displays
4. Check redirect to admin dashboard occurs
5. Confirm no sensitive error information is exposed

description: Verify that CSV export handles errors gracefully when data is unavailable
scenario: Admin attempts to export logs when database errors occur
expected_results: Appropriate error message displays and user is redirected when export fails
procedure:
1. Simulate database error during export
2. Click Export Logs button
3. Verify error message displays
4. Check redirect to logs page occurs
5. Confirm no corrupted files are downloaded

description: Verify that text truncation works correctly for long content in different log types
scenario: Admin reviews logs with long content to ensure proper truncation and readability
expected_results: Long content is truncated appropriately with ellipsis: subject lines, user agents, etc.
procedure:
1. View contact submissions with long subjects
2. Verify truncation to 30 characters on mobile, 50 on desktop
3. Check ellipsis appears for truncated content
4. Test responsive truncation behavior
5. Confirm full content is available via tooltip or expansion

description: Verify that page animations and transitions display correctly and enhance user experience
scenario: Admin observes page loading animations and filter change transitions
expected_results: Smooth fade-in animations for page elements with staggered timing: header, filters, content
procedure:
1. Refresh logs page to observe initial animations
2. Verify header animates first, followed by filters and table
3. Test filter change transitions
4. Check animation timing delays (0.1s, 0.2s, 0.3s)
5. Confirm animations work in both light and dark mode

description: Verify that all logs URLs route correctly and handle parameters appropriately
scenario: Admin tests various URL patterns for logs functionality
expected_results: Routes function correctly: /admin/logs, /admin/logs/export with proper parameter handling
procedure:
1. Test /admin/logs route directly
2. Test with log type parameter
3. Verify export route with different types
4. Check URL parameter validation
5. Test browser back/forward navigation

description: Verify that admin session management works correctly when accessing logs
scenario: Admin session expires while viewing logs to test session handling
expected_results: User is redirected to login when session expires, can return to logs after re-authentication
procedure:
1. Access logs with valid admin session
2. Wait for session to expire or manually clear session
3. Try to change log filters or export
4. Verify redirect to login occurs
5. Re-authenticate and confirm return to logs works

description: Verify that logs management performs efficiently with large datasets
scenario: Admin accesses logs with large numbers of entries to test performance
expected_results: Page loads efficiently with pagination limiting displayed logs, filter changes remain responsive
procedure:
1. Test logs with 1000+ entries
2. Verify pagination limits displayed entries appropriately
3. Test filter switching performance
4. Check export functionality with large datasets
5. Monitor page load times and responsiveness

description: Verify that logs functionality works correctly across different web browsers
scenario: Admin accesses logs using various browsers to test compatibility
expected_results: Page displays and functions correctly in Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge with consistent appearance and behavior
procedure:
1. Test logs in Google Chrome
2. Verify functionality in Mozilla Firefox
3. Check compatibility with Safari browser
4. Test in Microsoft Edge
5. Compare appearance and functionality across browsers

description: Verify that exported CSV files contain correct headers, data format, and encoding
scenario: Admin exports logs and validates CSV file content for accuracy and format
expected_results: CSV files contain proper headers, correctly formatted data, and appropriate encoding for each log type
procedure:
1. Export login attempts and verify CSV structure
2. Check headers match expected format
3. Verify data rows contain correct information
4. Test CSV opening in spreadsheet applications
5. Confirm filename format includes log type

description: Verify that log type filter selections persist across page navigation and refresh
scenario: Admin changes log filters and navigates to test state persistence
expected_results: Selected log type persists when navigating between pages and returning to logs
procedure:
1. Change log type to 'User Registrations'
2. Navigate away and return to logs page
3. Verify selected log type is maintained
4. Test with different log types
5. Check URL parameters reflect current selection

description: Verify that the logs interface meets accessibility standards for screen readers and keyboard navigation
scenario: Admin uses accessibility tools to test logs compliance with WCAG guidelines
expected_results: Page is fully accessible with proper ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, screen reader compatibility, and color contrast
procedure:
1. Test page with screen reader software
2. Navigate using only keyboard (Tab, Enter, Arrow keys)
3. Verify ARIA labels are present for filters and tables
4. Check color contrast ratios meet standards
5. Confirm all interactive elements are accessible

description: Verify that log data displayed matches actual system events and maintains data integrity
scenario: Admin compares displayed log data with actual system events to ensure accuracy
expected_results: Log entries accurately reflect system events with correct timestamps, statuses, and associated data
procedure:
1. Perform test login and verify it appears in login attempts
2. Create test user and check registration logs
3. Submit contact form and verify in contact submissions
4. Compare timestamps with actual event times
5. Verify all status indicators match actual outcomes
